repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Early Childhood Education
            Enhancement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Early Childhood Education
            Enhancement Project for the Arab Republic of Egypt aimed to
            support an increase in the access to early childhood
            education of 4 and 5 year-old children, particularly the
            disadvantaged, and also to equip kindergarten classes with
            learning materials. The outcome of the project is moderately
            satisfactory with both the Bank and the Borrower performed
            moderately satisfactory. A moderate risk to development was
            related to inadequate coordination between the Ministry of
            Education and the Ministry of Insurance and Social Affairs
            and subsequent involvement of participating NGOs and
            community run kindergartens.This was and continues to be a
            substantial risk to long-term sustainability of the
            project's outcomes. Lessons learned from the project
            include the following: 1) although project implementation
            units situated within the ministry are more effective than
            those established outside the ministry structure, careful
            planning is required to ensure leadership continuity; 2)
            plans for parallel financing and joint project activities
            with co-financing partners should be carefully designed,
            prepared for, coordinated, and implemented to avoid project
            delays; 3) project implementation plans and schedules should
            be more realistic, flexible and in-line with the Bank's
            previous country experience; and 4) assessment of impact and
            monitoring and evaluation of school construction projects
            may require a new approach.

repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Early Childhood Education
            Enhancement Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Early
            Childhood Education Enhancement Project is to support the
            Arab Republic of Egypt in providing quality early childhood
            education that improves the school readiness of 4 and 5 year
            old children, particularly the disadvantaged. The requested
            extension will allow for successful completion of the
            project activities especially those that require more time
            for proper implementation such as the curriculum component
            or for proper measurement of the impact of the project
            activities which needs data collection and observation in
            more than one (preferably several) school year. As a result
            of the delays which took place partly because of the
            ministerial changes and partly because of the January 25
            revolution, the approval is sought for extension of the
            project closing date. The government requested an extension
            of 24 months. Therefore, the new closing date will be June
            30, 2014. As explained earlier, this extension will allow
            the borrower time to complete the project activities in
            accordance with the agreed action plan in order to achieve
            the project developmental objective.

Egypt - Early Childhood Education
            Enhancement Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
